author: 0x_qz
content: Hi all, has devnet 5 been stopped? It seems that the block number always be 0x29125. And what is the schedule of devnet 6? We could not find a working devnet now...

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yes devnet 5 stopped, see dencun interop channel

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: <@552133098075193354> maybe we can get rid of this channel and only have the dencun testing channel?

author: karalabe
content: Seems there's another quirk in the 4844 type spec

author: karalabe
content: The transaction is defined as `rlp([chain_id, nonce, max_priority_fee_per_gas, max_fee_per_gas, gas_limit, to, value, data, access_list, max_fee_per_data_gas, blob_versioned_hashes, y_parity, r, s])`

author: karalabe
content: i.e. a few new fields, otherwise the old format

author: karalabe
content:
Then in validation, we go on to explicitly reject the `to` field being `nil`:

```
            # destination must be not be empty
            assert tx.to != None
```

author: karalabe
content: Shouldn't we instead have the `to` filed be mandatory instead of optional like other txs?

author: karalabe
content: Then a nil field could never happen, it would be rejected already during parsing from RLP or JSON or whereever

author: karalabe
content: So we w2ould remove a whole class of issues by allowing nil in the data struct bot forbidding it in reality

author: karalabe
content: Or do we envision enabling it in the future at some point and keeping it optional for that purpose?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I think any future blob tx type will have a different structure, so I would vote for making to mandatory in the rlp

author: karalabe
content: Hmmm, interestingly, an EL client *could* just ignore the spec and make it mandatory itself only

author: karalabe
content: Then Geth would reject the tx when it arrives at the network / from the engine API as invalid

author: karalabe
content: whereas "spec conforming" clients would accept it from the wire, but reject it later during validation

author: karalabe
content: The end result would be kind of the same, just a weird quirk

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Uh but that sounds like it could cause a bunch of issues

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Better to fail the same check on all clients

author: karalabe
content: yes, it could get werid, so my 2c is to fix the spec

author: karalabe
content: (I mean I doubt it would, but still)

author: __flcl
content: Nethermind plans to decline early on deserialization as for other non nullable fields

author: lightclient
content: so this check was _intended_ to convey that you could early reject blob txs with nil `to`, but i realize it isn't so clear so i will make it clearer

author: hsiaowei
content: fyi CL now has no tx validation after we changed it to RLP

author: lightclient
content: pr to update: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/7100

author: g11tech
content: correct, lodestar now treats it like any other opaque tx leaving the computed versioned hashes to tx versioned hashes matching to EL via new payload

author: timbeiko
content:
How about we do that after devnet-6, the last 4844-only devnet? 

Not a strong opinion, though: if people want to nuke it now and move to <#892088344438255616>, I'm happy with that too!
